main event: A disc-shaped object about the size of a half dollar was observed for about 2 minutes, with a bright white light seen at the top fading in and out.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on June 10, 1956, in Winchester, California., The object moved in a straight line before making a very fast 180-degree turn., The observation was made under clear visibility conditions., The analysis concluded that the object could possibly be a balloon or aircraft., The object was reported to have a color that transitioned from white to light pink.
sighted object: a disc-shaped object with a bright white light
witness description: Information about the witness is redacted.
